title: What songs can I play on a 32 key-piano? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technically anything, but the sound would be likely less ‘nice’. Want me to explain why? Well here goes… Generally, when you get to higher grades, more of the keyboard is required…  That’s the ending of the Nocturne in C# Minor by Chopin (really famous, I love it, play it all the time). As you can see the last note range is likely… over 32 notes. Grade 7 (ABRSM), if you’re curious.  That’s a small part of the middle section of the Nocturne in D Minor by Chopin (again Chopin lol). Just to save you the work, those bottom notes are just 4 semitones under the lowest key on the piano. Then the top notes (right hand) are above middle C. Which, as you can see, probably over 32 notes. Grade 8 (ABRSM), if you’re curious. I mean, you can play these songs with a 32 note piano. You would just need a huge amount of editing these pieces and it would likely not sound as good. TIP: Don’t try to use 32 note pianos for piano exams.

Anything. You just have to make adaptations if you are reading music, not be a slave to the notation and watch your octaves. I am actually playing a choral concert tomorrow night and the keyboard they have for me has only 61 notes and the piano score goes well beyond both ends. If I am improvising or faking it, it is not an issue because I am thinking in terms of notes rather than a score dictating where my hands are supposed to be. My choir sings in nursing homes a few dozen times a year and many of the pianos are in rough shape. In those cases you just learn where the bad notes are and avoid them, substitute something else or, as I like to do, revel in its ineffable crappiness.
